body_html: It might simplify building these libs in ATen, but since this is their source of truth, I think that we still want to be able to build them outside of it. Is it still possible? It seems like e.g. TH CMake files no longer look for OpenMP, so now all of them are tightly bound to ATen.
body_text: It might simplify building these libs in ATen, but since this is their source of truth, I think that we still want to be able to build them outside of it. Is it still possible? It seems like e.g. TH CMake files no longer look for OpenMP, so now all of them are tightly bound to ATen.
body: It might simplify building these libs in ATen, but since this is their source of truth, I think that we still want to be able to build them outside of it. Is it still possible? It seems like e.g. TH CMake files no longer look for OpenMP, so now all of them are tightly bound to ATen.
